intro: Coccoloba martii var. major, commonly known as the giant coccoloba, is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, followed by red or orange berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
